td.para: Camlinks Outlines are NOT DXF elements. Historical Note for Camlinks user: DXF files that were imported into a Camlinks file were saved as 'Outlines' in the Camlinks MEC file. When importing a Camlinks.MEC File into MechDesigner you have the option to leave the Camlinks 'Outlines' as 'Outlines', or they are changed into native MechDesigner Sketch-Elements. Keeping the outlines as dumb outlines is fast but inflexible. Converting the 'Outlines' to MechDesigner sketch-elements is slower but more flexible, and may not work. But, then you can edit them in the Part-Editor. If you are importing the Camlinks File for the first time, or you know the 'Outlines' are many and complex, then my advice is to use the 'Camlinks Outlines' Option in the Import Camlinks .MEC File.
